title: Welcome to COVID-19 Updates
description:
Welcome to our new blog. The first blog is the COVID-19 updates in the United States. 

Firstly, this blog will provide an interactive table for users/readers to explore the relevant information by themselves. 
It will not only offer them a chance to obtain an overview of the COVID-19 circumstance in the US but also
understand the relevant data or statistics better. 
Secondly, it will construct a numeric summary table to support the related story 
which helps the readers to understand the updated information regarding COVID-19 in the US comprehensively.

**We hope you enjoy the story and find some interesting insights!**

title: Blog-1
description: Entry 1 - The update of COVID-19 in the United States.
contents:
Contents
1. how can I make the subscribe.html work?
2. why I don’t have blog1.html in my docs/post folder?
3. the html code in Welcome rmd will not run in index html, why?
Target Country - United Stated
Data Description



1. how can I make the subscribe.html work?
2. why I don’t have blog1.html in my docs/post folder?
3. the html code in Welcome rmd will not run in index html, why?



Target Country - United Stated
Brief Introduction:
Data Description
This blog has used two main data sets as the base for the construction of data communication regarding COVID-19 information.
Data Source 1 - R Package nCov2019
The data set is collected from various sources for different relevant information.
- Latest data of corona virus cases from worldometers
- Historical data of corona virus cases from JHUCSSE
- Vaccine data from raps.org
- Therapeutics data from raps.org
This data source contains two core parts. First one is the GUI explorer section which has a function of dashboard to use a simple and interactive dashboard for information communication. Second part is the CLI analysis which includes a work flow from data query to data operation and lastly the visulization output of both geographic and animation plots.
This blog will focus on the CLI analysis part, which will query the update COVID-19 data from five different aspects. It will include the “latest update COVID-19 info.”, “global COVID-19 info.”, “historical COVID-19 info.”, “vaccine details”, “therapeutics status and progress”.

Here is the variable descriptions for this data source







Table 1: Variable Summary for Data Source 1


variable_names


description


active number


confirmed cases - deaths - recovered


activePerOneMillion


active number / million population


cases


confirmed cases


casesPerOneMillion


confirmed cases / million population


continent


continent


country


country


critical


Critical patients


criticalPerOneMillion


Critical patients / million population


date


date


deaths


deaths


deathsPerOneMillion


deaths patients / million population


oneCasePerPeople


one Case Per People


oneDeathPerPeople


one Death Per People


oneTestPerPeople


one Test Per People


population


population


recovered


recovered


recoveredPerOneMillion


recovered Per One Million


tests


COVID-19 test


testsPerOneMillion


COVID-19 test / million population


todayCases


confirmed cases in today


todayDeaths


confirmed death cases in today


todayRecovered


confirmed recovered cases in today


updated


the latest update time



Data Source 2 - New York Times Covid-19 data sets
This data source is collected by the journalists from the New York Times across several time zones to monitor news conferences and public data releases with seeking clarification from official bodies. It is under the license of CC BY-NC which allows the users to adapt the data with proper attribution given.

Contact Information: covid-data@nytimes.com


Here is the variable descriptions for this data source



Table 2: Variable Summary for Data Source 2


variable_name


types


description


date


character


date of record


state


character


state name (in US)


fips


integer


Federal Information Processing Standards (unique code for each state/counties)


cases


integer


confirmed cases (accumulated)


deaths


integer


confirmed deaths (accumulated)








latest data sets
